alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 02 at 2:06AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain will come to an end later this morning over the Olympics. Six hour rainfall totals ending at 2 am range from 1 to 2.5 inches. Another 1 to 1.5 inches is possible this morning. Snow levels will remain high, around 10,000 feet. This rainfall could push the Skokomish River to near or above flood stage this afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
